declarations.description:
A listbox following the W3C Listbox pattern.

<https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/listbox/>


`Single-select` listbox uses the "select follows focus" model.


`Multi-select` listbox implements the keyboard recommendations here: <https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/listbox/#keyboard_interaction>

  - <kbd>Shift + Down Arrow</kbd>: Moves focus to and toggles the selected state of the next option.
  - <kbd>Shift + Up Arrow</kbd>: Moves focus to and toggles the selected state of the previous option.
  - <kbd>Shift + Space</kbd>: Selects contiguous items from the most recently selected item to the focused item.
  - <kbd>Control + Shift + Home</kbd>: Selects the focused option and all options up to the first option. Optionally, moves focus to the first option.
  - <kbd>Control + Shift + End</kbd>: Selects the focused option and all options down to the last option.
  - <kbd>Control + a</kbd>: Selects all

  The currently hovered / focus `<role-option>` has `[aria-current="true"]`

  The currently selected `<role-option>` has `[aria-selected="true"]`
declarations.name: RoleListbox

members.name: handleKeyUp
members.description: Reset range when shiftKey goes up

members.name: selectFromClosestSelectedToCurrent
members.description: Finds the closest selected option prior to the current option

members.name: selectRange
members.description: Selects all options in a range and deselects all options not in the range

members.name: assignRandomId
members.description: Users dont always provide ids on elements, and we need to make sure the id isn't already taken.

members.name: searchBufferDelay
members.description: Delay before the search buffer returns to an empty string

members.name: optionObserver
members.description: Monitors its DOM for new nodes and assigns them to `this.options`

members.name: _searchBuffer
members.description: Internal buffer for searching the listbox.

members.name: _searchBufferDebounce
members.description: timeoutId to clear the search buffer

declarations.description:
Due to accessibility reasons with aria-describedby, the tooltip must be the same
  document / shadowRoot as the item being described by the tooltip.
declarations.name: RoleTooltip

members.name: listeners
members.default:
[
      ["pointerenter", this.show],
      ["pointerleave", this.hide],
      ["pointercancel", this.hide],
      ["pointerup", this.hide],
      ["focusin", this.show],
      ["focusout", this.hide],
      ["keydown", this.keyboardHide],
    ]

declarations.name: clamp
declarations.description:
If current > max, return max
If current < min, return min

declarations.name: isMacOs
declarations.description:
Detects if on a macOS device so we can properly bind things like metaKey
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/platform
> But there is one case where, among the options you could use, navigator.platform may be the least-bad option: When you need to show users advice about whether the modifier key for keyboard shortcuts is the ⌘ command key (found on Apple systems) rather than the ⌃ control key (on non-Apple systems):

declarations.name: uuidv4
declarations.description: uuid generator for attaching unique ids to attachments that need uploading.

declarations.name: wrap
declarations.description:
If current > max, return min
If current < min, return max
